application_type_full: Tree works: Trees in conservation areas/subject to TPOs
description:
TPO/2008/0590
Tree 1A (Yew) - Reduce crown by up to 1 metre and thin canopy by not more than 15% to shape canopy and to reduce interference with adjacent Oak (Tree 1, protected by TPO 590).  
Tree 2A (Holly) - Trim back north, west and south spreading branches to control lateral branch spread; trim back eastern spreading branches to provide clearance away from the adjacent flat entrance.
Tree 7 (Crab Apple) - Selective, light pruning of low weeping branches over the adjacent rhododendron.
Tree 8 (Yew) - Reduce crown by up to 1 metre and thin canopy by not more than 15% to shape canopy and to reduce interference with adjacent trees, and raise canopy by up to 1 metre from the ground.
Tree 10 (Holly) - Trim to maintain a neat and tight appearance new growth only and to thin canopy by not more than 15% and raise skirt of canopy up to 1 metre from the ground.
Tree 14 (2 x Grisellinia) - Reduce crown height by 1-2m and prune to reduce the lateral branch spreads in all directions by up to 1m, to maintain a balanced crown form and provide clearance over the west side footpath in the front garden; remove epicormic growth at base and up to canopy.
